com.iha.emulator.control.task

Class StopCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iha.emulator.control.task.StopCondition

  • public class StopCondition
extends java.lang.Object
    Class providing stop conditions for SimulationTask. If any of registered condition is met, task is stopped. Currently implemented 3 conditions: time duration condition, number of sent messages condition and number of messages waiting to be sent condition.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty conditionCounter
      Gets number of registered conditions property, that can be bound

    • Constructor Detail

      • StopCondition

        public StopCondition(SimulationTask task)
        Creates new instance for SimulationTask given as parameter. Conditions are initiated. No condition is registered by default.
        Parameters:
        task - task for which are stop conditions created

    • Method Detail

      • registerTimeDurationWatcher

        public void registerTimeDurationWatcher(long secondsToTrigger)
        Registers time duration condition. Needs task with existing TaskParameters and StopWatch instances to properly register condition. Time to stop given as parameter is bound to StopWatch.timeProperty().
        Parameters:
        secondsToTrigger - time in seconds, after which should be task stopped

      • registerSentMessageWatcher

        public void registerSentMessageWatcher(long messageCountToTrigger)
        Registers sent messages condition. Needs task with existing AdapterLogger and MessageTracker. Number of messages, after which task should stopped, given as parameter, is compared to MessageTracker.sentMessageCounterProperty().
        Parameters:
        messageCountToTrigger - number of messages, after which task should stopped

      • registerWaitingMessageWatcher

        public void registerWaitingMessageWatcher(long waitingMessagesToTrigger)
        Registers waiting messages condition. Needs task with existing AdapterLogger and MessageTracker. Number of messages, after which task should stopped, given as parameter, is compared to MessageTracker.waitingMessageCounterProperty().
        Parameters:
        waitingMessagesToTrigger - number of messages, after which task should stopped

      • unregisterTimeDurationWatcher

        public void unregisterTimeDurationWatcher()
        Unregisters time duration condition.

      • unregisterSentMessageWatcher

        public void unregisterSentMessageWatcher()
        Unregisters sent messages condition.

      • unregisterWaitingMessageWatcher

        public void unregisterWaitingMessageWatcher()
        Unregisters waiting messages condition.

      • initWatchers

        private void initWatchers()
        Initializes actions, that are called, after conditions are met.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts conditions checking

      • unregisterAllConditions

        public void unregisterAllConditions()
        Unregisters all registered conditions.

      • saveToXml

        public org.dom4j.Element saveToXml(org.dom4j.Element rootElement)
        Creates Dom4j XML element for condition parameters This element is added to root element given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        rootElement - root Dom4j XML element for server
        Returns:
        XML element
